adjective.description: Most prominent in rank, importance, or position.
examples: one of the foremost art collectors of his day

adverb.description: Before anything else in rank, importance, or position; in the first place.
examples: O'Keefe's work was, foremost, an expression of the feelings of a woman

origin: Old English formest, fyrmest, from forma first (ultimately a superlative formed from the Germanic base of fore)+ -est. Compare with first and former. The current spelling arose by association with fore and most.
